ygData.subject: Re: Crawl orders / ServerCache problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Thank you for the quick responce, the Preselector and PreconditionEnforcer togeather as the pre-fetch- processor step cleared everything up. Just a note the

Thank you for the quick responce,

the Preselector and PreconditionEnforcer togeather as the pre-fetch-
processor step cleared everything up.

Just a note the original error was 

Start Error:

2005-06-22T20:00:15.609Z    -2          - http://www.spin.com/ - - no-
type #001 - - -
 java.io.IOException: Failed to get host www.spin.com address from 
ServerCache

End Error:

Thank you very much,
Brian M. Lima






--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> brianmlima wrote:
> 
> > Hello all,
> >
> > Where can I get version 1.6, is it possible without using CVS?
> 
> Its not yet released.
> 
> >
> > I'm having a very frustrating problem with 1.4.0 on Win2k Advanced
> > Server (Unfortunately my Gentoo dev box is on the fritz and I'm in
> > the middle of a rapid prototyping contract so I do not have the 
time
> > to get it back up). I have my startup script written as 
recommended
> > with the proper classpath in the proper order. Everything seems 
to be
> > in order except I always get the ServerCache error for any domain 
or
> > ip address I try to crawl.
> 
> What is ServerCache error?
> 
> > The box is not running anything else and
> > is not firewalled. (I thought for a moment that my firewall was
> > giving Heritrix a hard time but that seems unlikely, I just 
wanted to
> > get that out of the way before asking for help.)
> >
> > I am counting on Heritrix to feed a knowledge refinery before the
> > weekend. Perhaps there is an issue with my crawl order? Could 
someone
> > post or send me a domain scope crawl order that is known to be
> > working? I can fill in the seeds. The order I have uses no pre-
fetch-
> > processors, another post suggested eliminating this part of the 
chain.
> >
> This is probably your issue.  You'll need the Preselector and 
> PreconditionEnforcer that are the usual occupants of the 
> pre-fetch-processor step.
> 
> Try using an order based off one of the profiles setting user-agent 
and 
> from and supplying a couple of seeds.
> 
> St.Ack
> 
> 
> > I would like to lend a hand developing, I like the architecture 
and
> > plan to be using it for a few projects but I have to get some 
crawls
> > running first.
> >
> > Thank you in advance any help will be greatly appreciated,
> >
> > Brian M. Lima
> > brianmlima@y...
> >
> >
> >
